item.title: Examine files in transit from pcap files in Linux
item.description: In order for us to have a friendly interface for analizing network capture files (pcap), it’s very useful to have monitoring tools like Network Miner, which lets us extract the data in transit as it happened at the time of the capture. It also allows us to “sniff” communications in real time but for this time we will only be using it for reading an already existing .pcap file.

item.title: Windows Terminal: Keeping a neat and clean workspace
item.description: When it comes to open sessions, monitoring your network or communicate between servers/hosts, organization is key for an agile mind. While there are lots of options to establish a connection between hosts (Like Termius, PuTTY, or even the original terminal), I found the new Windows Terminal app to be just perfect for handling multiple sessions at once. item.description: The results of this guidelines render only a casual-use Firefox configuration.
